Sub:- 
Advance check-in of passengers at Airport. 
 
In supersession of this Bureau Circular No. 27/2000 dated 8.9.2000 and in 
order to allow the facility of advance check-in by family members/ groups of 
passengers at airports in India, the following instructions shall be implemented by all 
concerned: 
 
(i) 
The registered baggage should be accepted only after screening through X-
ray or manually to the entire satisfaction of the screener and application of 
prescribed security controls by the Airlines operator; 
(ii) 
The checked baggage shall remain in the custody of the Airlines and will 
be physically secured/ guarded at all times till loaded into aircraft, to avoid 
contamination; 
(iii) 
The baggage shall be reconciled at the time of departure of flight 
alongwith other passengers; 
(iv) 
In case, a passenger does not report for boarding out of this group, it shall 
be ensured by physical identification that his baggage is not transported on 
board by Airlines; 
(v) 
There may be a distinct marking on the boarding card of passengers who 
are allowed such facilities to avoid delay during Gate No Show Drill. 
 
 
 
(R.C. Tayal) 
Offg. Commissioner of Security (CA)
